verses.kjv: Furthermore Elihu answered and said,
verses.ct: Then Elihu continued and said,

verses.kjv: Hear my words, O ye wise men; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.
verses.ct: "Listen to what I have to say, you wise men; pay attention, you who have knowledge.

verses.kjv: For the ear trieth words, as the mouth tasteth meat.
verses.ct: The ear tests words the same way the tongue tastes food.

verses.kjv: Let us choose to us judgment: let us know among ourselves what is good.
verses.ct: Let us decide together what is right; let us determine among ourselves what is good.

verses.kjv: For Job hath said, I am righteous: and God hath taken away my judgment.
verses.ct: Job has claimed, 'I am righteous, but God has denied me justice.'

verses.kjv: Should I lie against my right? my wound is incurable without transgression.
verses.ct: He says, 'Should I be considered a liar despite being in the right? My wound is beyond healing, even though I have not sinned.'

verses.kjv: What man is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water?
verses.ct: What person is like Job, who gulps down mockery like water?

verses.kjv: Which goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, and walketh with wicked men.
verses.ct: He keeps company with those who do evil and walks alongside wicked people.

verses.kjv: For he hath said, It profiteth a man nothing that he should delight himself with God.
verses.ct: He has said, 'It does a person no good to try to please God.'

verses.kjv: Therefore hearken unto me ye men of understanding: far be it from God, that he should do wickedness; and from the Almighty, that he should commit iniquity.
verses.ct: So listen to me, you men of understanding: it is unthinkable that God would do evil, or that the Almighty would commit wrongdoing.

verses.kjv: For the work of a man shall he render unto him, and cause every man to find according to his ways.
verses.ct: He pays people back for what they have done and makes sure everyone gets what their actions deserve.

verses.kjv: Yea, surely God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.
verses.ct: Truly, God does not act wickedly, and the Almighty does not twist justice.

verses.kjv: Who hath given him a charge over the earth? or who hath disposed the whole world?
verses.ct: Who appointed him over the earth? Who put him in charge of the entire world?

verses.kjv: If he set his heart upon man, if he gather unto himself his spirit and his breath;
verses.ct: If God decided to withdraw his spirit and his breath back to himself,

verses.kjv: All flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again unto dust.
verses.ct: every living thing would die at once, and humanity would return to dust.

verses.kjv: If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.
verses.ct: Now if you have understanding, listen to this; pay attention to what I am saying.

verses.kjv: Shall even he that hateth right govern? and wilt thou condemn him that is most just?
verses.ct: Could someone who hates justice actually govern? Will you condemn the one who is perfectly just?

verses.kjv: Is it fit to say to a king, Thou art wicked? and to princes, Ye are ungodly?
verses.ct: Is it appropriate to tell a king, 'You are worthless'? Or to say to nobles, 'You are wicked'?

verses.kjv: How much less to him that accepteth not the persons of princes, nor regardeth the rich more than the poor? for they all are the work of his hands.
verses.ct: How much less should we speak that way to the one who shows no favoritism to rulers and does not value the rich above the poor? They are all the work of his hands.

verses.kjv: In a moment shall they die, and the people shall be troubled at midnight, and pass away: and the mighty shall be taken away without hand.
verses.ct: In an instant people die; in the middle of the night they are shaken and pass away. The powerful are removed, but not by human hands.

verses.kjv: For his eyes are upon the ways of man, and he seeth all his goings.
verses.ct: God's eyes watch every step a person takes; he sees all their movements.

verses.kjv: There is no darkness, nor shadow of death, where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
verses.ct: There is no darkness deep enough, no shadow dark enough, where evildoers can hide from him.

verses.kjv: For he will not lay upon man more than right; that he should enter into judgment with God.
verses.ct: God does not need to examine a person further for them to come before him in judgment.

verses.kjv: He shall break in pieces mighty men without number, and set others in their stead.
verses.ct: He shatters powerful people without investigation and puts others in their place.

verses.kjv: Therefore he knoweth their works, and he overturneth them in the night, so that they are destroyed.
verses.ct: Because he knows what they have done, he overthrows them in the night and they are crushed.

verses.kjv: He striketh them as wicked men in the open sight of others;
verses.ct: He strikes them down for their wickedness in plain view of everyone,

verses.kjv: Because they turned back from him, and would not consider any of his ways:
verses.ct: because they turned away from following him and refused to respect any of his ways.

verses.kjv: So that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto him, and he heareth the cry of the afflicted.
verses.ct: They caused the cry of the poor to reach him, and he heard the plea of the oppressed.

verses.kjv: When he giveth quietness, who then can make trouble? and when he hideth his face, who then can behold him? whether it be done against a nation, or against a man only:
verses.ct: When he grants peace, who can create turmoil? When he withdraws his favor, who can find him? This applies whether it is a nation or an individual.

verses.kjv: That the hypocrite reign not, lest the people be ensnared.
verses.ct: He does this to keep godless people from ruling, so that the people are not trapped.

verses.kjv: Surely it is meet to be said unto God, I have borne chastisement, I will not offend any more:
verses.ct: Suppose someone says to God, 'I have endured my punishment; I will not sin anymore.

verses.kjv: That which I see not teach thou me: if I have done iniquity, I will do no more.
verses.ct: Show me what I cannot see; if I have done wrong, I will not do it again.'

verses.kjv: Should it be according to thy mind? he will recompense it, whether thou refuse, or whether thou choose; and not I: therefore speak what thou knowest.
verses.ct: Should God reward you on your own terms? You are the one who must decide, not me. So tell us what you think.

verses.kjv: Let men of understanding tell me, and let a wise man hearken unto me.
verses.ct: People with understanding will tell me, and any wise person listening to me will agree:

verses.kjv: Job hath spoken without knowledge, and his words were without wisdom.
verses.ct: Job has spoken without knowledge, and his words lack wisdom.

verses.kjv: My desire is that Job may be tried unto the end because of his answers for wicked men.
verses.ct: I wish Job would be tested to the limit, because his answers are like those of wicked people.

verses.kjv: For he addeth rebellion unto his sin, he clappeth his hands among us, and multiplieth his words against God.
verses.ct: He adds rebellion on top of his sin; he claps his hands in defiance among us and piles up his arguments against God."
